text: South Street Park is a former baseball ground located in Indianapolis, Indiana, USA. The ground was home to the Indianapolis Blues of the National League for the 1878 season. The ground first hosted baseball for the city's International Association entry during 1876–1877. It was also a neutral site for some Chicago White Stockings games during 1878. The ballfield was located on a block bounded by Delaware Avenue (west); South Street (south); and Alabama Street (east). The site was later occupied by Big Four freight houses. It is currently a parking lot for Bankers Life Fieldhouse, which is across the street to the west. ==References== *Peter Filichia, Professional Baseball Franchises, Facts on File, 1993. * * Category:Defunct baseball venues in the United States Category:Sports venues in Indianapolis Category:Baseball venues in Indiana Category:Defunct sports venues in Indiana
title: South Street Park
